alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 5:29PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Slow moving thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado through 615 PM MDT... At 527 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking an isolated thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Cheyenne Wells. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Torrential rain. Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Torrential rainfall with this storm may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, including the following locations... Arapahoe. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
